posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Well, this not a task for amateurs. You need to know how to set up port forwarding for your particular router and firewall. But if you are a networking admin, you should have the authority to control and customize the port forwarding yourself.

Here are a few links which relate applicable information and pose some solutions:

http://support.microsoft.com/kb/323712
http://www.overclockers.com/forums/show ... p?t=516936
http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/wind ... oxy-server
http://portforward.com/

Keep in mind, that setting up a proxy server properly to handle communications between game servers requires intimate knowledge of the equipment you are using. In my own experience, even when adequate ports have been set up, running a game through a proxy is very slow and drop-outs are common and unpredictable, being based on whether the packets are moving fast enough. You are welcome to try, but I think you may be disappointed in the performance even after you have configured it properly... which is probably why there are so few instructional outlets on the Web for this sort of thing... it's just not worth all the effort.
